thread.title_full: Boston Marathon Bombing Survivor In Sioux Falls

title: Boston Marathon Bombing Survivor In Sioux Falls
text:
Boston Marathon Bombing Survivor In Sioux Falls October 21, 2015, 1:16 PM by Casey Wonnenberg SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
A survivor of the Boston Marathon bombing is in Sioux Falls to raise awareness for people with disabilities. Heather Abbott was at the finish line during the bombings. 
Doctors had to amputate part of her left leg because of her injuries. She now travels across the country speaking at events. On Wednesday, she's in Sioux Falls for the Disabilities Rights Conference. 
"If I were standing with my metal leg, people would know, and they treat me differently. I can't say that I wouldn't have done the same thing myself before I became an amputee. I think people are just sometimes afraid to say the wrong thing," Abbott said. 
Tonight on HealthBeat on KELOLAND News at 6 p.m. hear from a South Dakota official about the steps the state still needs to take to help those with disabilities. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
